bill_title: provide for certain inmates to petition for concurrent sentences.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for certain inmates to petition for concurrent sentences. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 24-15A be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Notwithstanding any other law, for any inmate serving consecutive sentences, the inmate may petition the sentencing court to have the sentences made concurrent if the inmate: (1) Was sentenced for a conviction of a Class 2 felony or below; (2) Has served at least ten consecutive years of the total sentenced to be served; (3) Is at least sixty years of age; (4) Is considered a chronic care or extensive care inmate, and whose care costs or will cost the department at least one hundred fifty percent of the average cost per inmate; (5) Has adequate resources for care upon release, including living accommodations and health care; (6) Is in compliance with all rules of discipline, including the inmate's individual program directive; and (7) Does not present a threat to public safety upon release.
